alert.note: Alert for Custer; Garfield; Loup (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 10:33PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Loup, southwestern Garfield and northeastern Custer Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1033 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Weissert, or 13 miles east of Broken Bow, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burwell, Taylor, Sargent, Comstock, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Weissert, Westerville, Lillian, Round Valley, Walworth, Virginia Smith Dam, Hannamon Bayou Campground, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Wescott, Kent Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Big Oak Canyon, Nunda Shoal Campground, Divide Hill and Valley View Flat Campground. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 93 and 132. Highway 92 between mile markers 304 and 308. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central Nebraska.
